intro: Hieracium echioides subsp. procerum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with upright stems that are often hairy and covered in glandular dots. Its basal leaves are lanceolate and gradually become smaller as they ascend the stem, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats.
